purpose: Render the NexaCompute documentation set stored under docs/ as a Mintlify site.

structure_summary.description: Onboarding flows and day-one execution guides for NexaCompute operators.
System-level architecture, policies, and module explanations located in Overview_of_Project/.
Execution playbooks for the data, distillation, and training pipeline.
Daily execution plans, production summaries, and postmortems.
Cost breakdowns and ROI evaluation for Falcon distillation runs.
Persistent policies, cleanup standards, and system specifications.

setup_steps.title: Install Mintlify tooling
setup_steps.notes: Use a Node version manager such as fnm or nvm if you need to match the Mintlify-supported Node release.

setup_steps.title: Initialize Mintlify project files
setup_steps.notes: If mintlify init asks to create example content, decline so the existing docs directory remains untouched.

setup_steps.title: Configure navigation in mint.json
actions: Open mint.json at the repository root.
Replace the navigation section with the mintlify_navigation_template.navigation array shown below.
Update logo, social, or analytics fields if desired.

setup_steps.title: Add frontmatter to Markdown files where needed
setup_steps.notes: Mintlify slugs are derived from frontmatter. Add a title and slug to each Markdown file, especially when nesting under subdirectories.
setup_steps.example_frontmatter:
---
title: Start Here
slug: /start-here
description: Day-one execution checklist for NexaCompute.
---

setup_steps.title: Verify internal links and assets
actions: Move any images or attachments into docs/assets/ (create the directory if it does not exist).
Rewrite relative links so they reference the Mintlify slug (for example, /overview/architecture).

local_preview.notes: Mintlify automatically watches the docs directory and reloads on file changes.

content_validation.notes: Run inside the repository root to surface broken links, missing frontmatter, or formatting issues.

static_export.notes: Creates a static bundle inside the dist/ directory that can be hosted on any static site provider.

deployment_options.instructions: Use mintlify deploy to push the site to Mintlify hosting. Requires linking the repository to a Mintlify project dashboard.
Serve the build output from dist/ via Netlify, Vercel, GitHub Pages, or a static bucket. Configure the target host to rewrite requests to index.html.

content_notes: Keep Markdown headings in sentence case so Mintlify automatically generates clean URLs when slugs are omitted.
Replace inline HTML tables with Markdown tables when possible for consistent styling.
Highlight code blocks with fenced syntax (```bash) so Mintlify applies syntax highlighting correctly.
Add tags or metadata to mint.json if you plan to expose search facets.

quality_checks.method: Run mintlify lint and manually click through navigation during mintlify dev.
Add description and og metadata in mint.json or individual frontmatter entries.
Optimize large diagrams before placing them in docs/assets/.
